intro: Licaria parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved licaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
